ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Data analysis (two-photon microscopy data). coding fruit fly surgery time management

I had no previous experience studying AD, yet Dr. Strittmatter and his team graciously familiarized me the with the current state of the field and introduced me to a number of techniques commonly used to study AD pathophysiology. Most notably, I learned how to conduct extracellular field potential recordings of mouse hippocampal slices to measure the effects of soluble amyloid beta on LTP ex vivo and to screen compounds for their potential therapeutic value based on their ability to rescue ABo-induced LTP inhibition.
Much in dealing with complex neurodevelopmental problems

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A journal club would help new students gain a insight of the topic quickly.
Weekly lab meetings were an excellent way to stay in touch with the PI, earn constructive feedback and to make sure I was on track and meeting expectations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Damon is a really nice and smart PI. I learned a lot from him. And received a lot of help from other lab members as well.
